sections.content: Medical students and recent graduates who conduct scientific research and wish to present their work at the congress can apply. Abstracts will undergo a preliminary evaluation by the jury based on blind review criteria. Presentations of the abstracts that pass the preliminary evaluation will be conducted in two categories: oral and poster presentations. Both categories will be evaluated by the jury, and awards will be given for first, second, and third place.
Students who qualify to present their scientific studies in the oral presentation sessions, based on the dates and criteria set by the congress jury, will be included in the program.

Poster presentations will not be part of the scientific program flow but will be held in the congress foyer at designated times, to be determined later, during appropriate time slots within the scientific program hours, in the presence of participants and the jury.

Summaries of speeches and presentations included in the scientific program will be published in the abstract book. The abstract book, which will be shared through announcement channels (printed and electronic media) after the event, will serve as a tangible output of the congress.

At the congress, medical students and recent graduates presented their accepted oral and poster abstracts after a blind review. Oral presentations took place in the main program, while posters were displayed in the foyer. Awards were given to top presenters, and all accepted abstracts were published in the congress abstract book.
